class_description: You use the string(from:) method to create a localized representation of an NSMeasurement object, and you use the string(from:) method to create a localized representation of an Unit object. The formatter takes into account the specified locale, unitStyle, and unitOptions when producing string representations of units and measurements.

return_description: A user-readable string that represents the measurement.

Methods.method_description: Creates and returns a localized string representation of the provided measurement.

params.param_description: The unit of measure to be represented.

return_description: A user-readable string that represents the unit of measure. If the unit cannot be localized, the unit’s symbol value is used.

Methods.method_description: Creates and returns a localized string representation of the provided unit of measure.

Methods.method_declar: func string<UnitType>(from measurement: Measurement<UnitType>) -> String where UnitType : Unit

Vars.var_description: The options for how the unit is formatted.
The number formatter used to format the quantity of a measurement.
